p: We need to consider the future course of COVID-19, which, as of February 12, 2020, had spread to 64 countries with 87,137 confirmed cases and 2979 deaths (Table 1). With globalization, coronaviruses will spread, and there will be similar outbreaks of different mutant strains in the coming years. With increased international scientific collaboration, we may develop more powerful means of fighting coronaviruses, and we may understand the genome structure very well in the future. We have to be conscious of the challenges and worries 2019-nCoV has brought to our communities worldwide. Strenuous efforts should be made to learn about about and control the disease, and the time to act is now.
